channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Global trade at risk as tensions escalate in South China Sea
item.description: Rising naval tensions in the South China Sea are increasingly posing risks to some of the world’s most vital shipping lanes, experts warn.

item.title: Stellantis ousts CFO, other top execs in bid to ‘redouble’ its focus
UK economy returns to growth as Labour tees up all-important budget
item.description: The U.K. economy returned to growth in August following two consecutive months of stagnation, providing a slight boost for the Labour government.

item.title: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Japanese atomic bomb survivors
Italian carmaker Stellantis overhauls C-Suite as CEO set to retire in 2026
item.description: CEO Carlos Tavares faced pressure as the carmaker fights low sales in the U.S. and a bloated inventory.

item.title: Nobel Peace Prize 2024 awarded to Japanese atomic bomb survivor organization Nihon Hidankyo
item.description: Japanese atomic bomb survivor organization Nihon Hidankyo won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday.

item.title: Obama slams ‘crazy’ Trump in his first campaign rally for Harris
item.description: Obama trained his fire on Trump during a pumped-up rally in Pittsburgh, comparing the Republican's long speeches to late Cuban communist leader Fidel ...

item.title: Groceries are more affordable now than in 2019. Prices are still a big issue.
Tesla shares drop 6% in premarket after Cybercab robotaxi reveal fails to impress
item.description: Shares of electric vehicle maker Tesla tumbled Friday after the company's long-awaited robotaxi event failed to impress investors.

item.title: Richard Branson avoids gossip at all costs. Here’s why that might backfire on him.
item.description: "Everything comes back to people,” the billionaire business magnate said regarding his success.

item.title: Salesforce's UK chief urges government not to regulate all AI companies in the same way
item.description: Salesforce's CEO of U.K. and Ireland told CNBC the firm takes all legislation "seriously" but wants anticipated regulations to be "proportional and ta...

item.title: Tesla stock dives 6% in premarket trade after robotaxi event
Tesla unveils its Cybercab robotaxi, with no steering wheel or pedals
Struggling auto giant Stellantis says CEO Carlos Tavares will retire in 2026 when his contract ends
item.description: The U.S.-French-Italian company whose brands include Chrysler, Citroen, Fiat and Jeep is going through a rough patch, in particular with sales in Nort...

item.title: Rafael Nadal ends tennis career as second highest earner in ATP
item.description: Nadal will leave the sport as its second-highest earner of career prize money with more than $130 million.
